channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024070729
item.description:
Report X-2024070729

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-09
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The spill happened during the day sort. One (1) of the four (4) contents was ripped on a lower side thar caused its entire gallon to be leaked out. The remaining were placed in a lined salvage drum for instructions on disposal process.

item.title: Report X-2024070736
item.description:
Report X-2024070736

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-09
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND ALSO WAS WET ALL OVER THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE. IT WAS IMMEDIATELY TAKEN OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE IT AND VENTILATE IT. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 10 LITERS LEAKED OUT ALTOGETHER FROM THE 4 BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. ONE BOTTLE HAS A PUNCTURE AND THE OTHER 3 BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS WHICH IS WHY IT WAS LEAKING IN THE FIRST PLACE. WAITING FOR THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH NOW.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort. inspection showed package to be wet with internal leakage, torn open, and 1 of 4 items with a loose cap. Damage most likely from being placed on wrong conveyor belt. Remaining contents will be returned to shipper, unless otherwise stated.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: It was noted that the spill was caused by a small puncture at the top right. and also, at the cap of the plastic Jerrican. Approximately 0.25 lg was leaked from the 5-gallon Jerrican. After inspection, it was placed in a lined salvage drum for disposition instruction.

item.title: Report E-2024070164
item.description:
Report E-2024070164

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: WEST DEPTFORD
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 28, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1738 was punctured and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 95-gallon overpack. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted pavement and trailer floor and swept them in with hand tools. Two (2) 55-gallon drums of spent absorbents and any cleanup debris were generated as waste.

  • Description: DURING THE OVER NGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE UPON INSPECTION 1 JERRICAN OF ZEP CONCENTRATE INDUSTRIAL PURPLE DEGREASER WAS FOUND TO BE 1/4 WAY LEAKED OUT FROM THE CAP BEING LOOSE.THE REMAINING CONTENT WAS PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE.

item.title: Report X-2024070448
item.description:
Report X-2024070448

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-10T18:16:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-04
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE OVN SORT I WAS CALLED INTO CENTRAL. UPON INSPECTION TWO OF FOUR BOTTLES OF ECOLAB AQUA BALANCE MURIATIC ACID WAS FOUND INSIDE THE CHUTE. ONE BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP AND THE OTHER WAS PUNCTURED AND FULLY LEAKED OUT. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE.
